intro: Micranthes gageana, commonly known as the Gage's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Micranthes gageana is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation and high sunlight exposure.
